title: How to Build Wooden Toys

steps.headline: To make a wooden toy horse, get a big piece of wood and carve it into a horse-like body shape.
steps.description: Give it a tummy and smooth out any extra chips of wood.

steps.headline: Carve out two skinny shapes of wood for the legs.
steps.description: Make bumpy and slick like a horse's legs. Add hooves by shaping them hoof like and a little out a bit. Make two front legs for the wooden horse.

steps.headline: Make legs almost the same way as the front legs,but back legs need to be carved bended a little.
While carving the body, don't forget to carve the head along with it.
steps.description: Create a face with eyes,nostrils,snout,mouth,and ears.

steps.headline: If any loose places, hot glue them together.
steps.description: Sometimes you can carve the whole thing out of wood from the start, just from one piece of wood.

steps.headline: Paint if wanted.
Chop a piece of wood roof shaped at the top and cube like at the bottom.
steps.description: Try to start from a small cube and carve out a roof like shape.

steps.headline: Chop a triangle roof.
Carve out a door, brick like walls,brick like shape on the roof, and some windows.
steps.description: Make a window frame and if you want, carve out some plants behind the window frame as if people put plants at their window.

steps.headline: Hot glue loose pieces together.
Paint if wanted.
Carve out a body of the dinosaur.
steps.description: Make sure the wood is big enough so you can carve along with the body, the tail, and the head.

steps.headline: Make a mouth and try to hot glue some teeth in the mouth with small chips of wood.If you can't, carve them along.
steps.description: Detail the mouth and make it look like the dinosaur is roaring by carving the mouth open. Add a tongue to the mouth.

steps.headline: Add nostrils to the nose's tip.
Add and carve out the rest of the face.
Carve out legs and make three toes on each foot.
steps.description: Add claws if wanted and make the legs look big and strong like a real dinosaur.

steps.headline: Make small arms with two fingers.
Paint if wanted.
Chop out a rectangular shape,almost like a small brick.
Add detail to the small brick.
Carve a hollow inside.
Make a square holder with one opening.
steps.description: Hammer the holder with nails on the small brick like shaped piece of wood. Make sure the nails won't come loose so the toy wouldn't be dangerous and the holder fits to go through.

steps.headline: Paint if wanted.
Chop a piece of wood hollow rectangular and has three openings: left side, right side, and front.
steps.description: Not the back though. Carve it and make sure it looks like a book cover.

steps.headline: To make pages, chop flat pieces of wood that fit inside the book cover.
steps.description: Hot glue them to make sure they stay. Once the space is full, you can now stop adding pages.

steps.headline: Carve the title of the book.
Paint if wanted.
Chop a piece of wood into a cube.
steps.description: Chop off a smaller cube, but leave enough for the computer's back.

steps.headline: Chop a flat rectangle, small, and a little bigger flat circle.
steps.description: Hot glue them together. Then hot glue the top. Make a frame and add some carved buttons on the wooden computer, such as the on/off button. Make a screen by carving things l

steps.headline: Make a frame to the top part.
Add some computer buttons on the wooden toy computer, such as the on/off button.
Add things to the screen.
steps.description: You can carve a picture of icons, such as firefox or google chrome to the screen. Or add other things. (Finder, TextEdit,Safari,etc)

steps.headline: To make the keyboard, chop a flat rectangle.
Carve out the keys.
Paint if wanted.
Chop a flat circle.
Carve words and other things on it.
Paint if desired.

text: Wooden Toy Horse To make a wooden toy horse, get a big piece of wood and carve it into a horse-like body shape. Give it a tummy and smooth out any extra chips of wood. Carve out two skinny shapes of wood for the legs. Make bumpy and slick like a horse's legs. Add hooves by shaping them hoof like and a little out a bit. Make two front legs for the wooden horse. Make legs almost the same way as the front legs,but back legs need to be carved bended a little. Also, make hooves. While carving the body, don't forget to carve the head along with it. Create a face with eyes,nostrils,snout,mouth,and ears. If any loose places, hot glue them together. Sometimes you can carve the whole thing out of wood from the start, just from one piece of wood. Paint if wanted.  Wooden Toy House Chop a piece of wood roof shaped at the top and cube like at the bottom. Try to start from a small cube and carve out a roof like shape. Chop a triangle roof.  Carve out a door, brick like walls,brick like shape on the roof, and some windows. Make a window frame and if you want, carve out some plants behind the window frame as if people put plants at their window. Hot glue loose pieces together.  Paint if wanted.  Wooden Toy Dinosaur Carve out a body of the dinosaur. Make sure the wood is big enough so you can carve along with the body, the tail, and the head. Make a mouth and try to hot glue some teeth in the mouth with small chips of wood.If you can't, carve them along. Detail the mouth and make it look like the dinosaur is roaring by carving the mouth open. Add a tongue to the mouth. Add nostrils to the nose's tip.  Add and carve out the rest of the face. (eyes, etc) Carve out legs and make three toes on each foot. Add claws if wanted and make the legs look big and strong like a real dinosaur. Make small arms with two fingers. Add claws if wanted. Paint if wanted.  Wooden Toy Basket Chop out a rectangular shape,almost like a small brick.  Add detail to the small brick.  Carve a hollow inside. After all, baskets are hollow. Make a square holder with one opening. Hammer the holder with nails on the small brick like shaped piece of wood. Make sure the nails won't come loose so the toy wouldn't be dangerous and the holder fits to go through. Paint if wanted.  Wooden Toy Book Chop a piece of wood hollow rectangular and has three openings: left side, right side, and front. Not the back though. Carve it and make sure it looks like a book cover. To make pages, chop flat pieces of wood that fit inside the book cover. Hot glue them to make sure they stay. Once the space is full, you can now stop adding pages. Carve the title of the book.  Paint if wanted.  Wooden Toy Computer with Keyboard Chop a piece of wood into a cube. Chop off a smaller cube, but leave enough for the computer's back. Chop a flat rectangle, small, and a little bigger flat circle. Hot glue them together. Then hot glue the top. Make a frame and add some carved buttons on the wooden computer, such as the on/off button. Make a screen by carving things l Make a frame to the top part.  Add some computer buttons on the wooden toy computer, such as the on/off button.  Add things to the screen. You can carve a picture of icons, such as firefox or google chrome to the screen. Or add other things. (Finder, TextEdit,Safari,etc) To make the keyboard, chop a flat rectangle.  Carve out the keys.  Paint if wanted.  Wooden Toy Frisbee Chop a flat circle.  Carve words and other things on it.  Paint if desired.
